definition: to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Losses of the PBC shall be setoff by allocations of the central finance.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民銀行的虧損由中央財政撥款彌補。

sentences.english: Five thousand dollars has been appropriated for the new school buildings.
sentences.chinese: 已撥款五千元爲建設新校舍之用。

sentences.english: The UGC advises the Government on the development of these institutions and on their financial needs.
sentences.chinese: 教資會就各院校的發展和撥款需要，向政府提供意見。

sentences.english: The government has committed billions toward defraying the costs of the war.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承諾撥款數十億支付戰爭的開支。

sentences.english: The projects, commonly known as earmarks, cost billions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 這些俗稱專項撥款的項目會耗費數十億美元。

sentences.english: The city government has allocated money to help the schools cover the cost ofthe installation, state-run Xinhua news agency reported.
sentences.chinese: 新華社報道，市政府已經撥款幫忙學校支付安裝費用。

sentences.english: The cost of the project will be defrayed by a government grant.
sentences.chinese: 這項計劃的費用將由政府撥款支付。

sentences.english: It was rated as 'excellent' by the national funding council.
sentences.chinese: 它被評爲由國家撥款的優秀大學。

sentences.english: Carmen and "Chloe" of "LSG" and Exhibition Prague 2.
sentences.chinese: 卡門和克洛從整筆撥款模式與畫廊布拉格會議2。

sentences.english: Moreover, it's probably not money well spent -- at least in the developing world.
sentences.chinese: 再者，至少在發展中國家，撥款於加固工程不合算。

sentences.english: The Gongshu District also planned to allot 100 million yuan to further improve the conditions of schools.
sentences.chinese: 拱墅區政府還計劃撥款一億元用來推進學校建設。

sentences.english: What happens after the appropriations bills come through?
sentences.chinese: 撥款法案通過以後，會出現什麼情況？
就是‘指定撥款’和‘豬肉桶’支出。

sentences.english: Legal aid services are funded by the Government. The provision for legal costs is not cash-limited;
sentences.chinese: 法援服務由政府撥款提供，法援經費不設款額上限。

sentences.english: This removed debtservice from the politics of annual appropriations.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就將償債剝離於年度撥款的政治活動。

sentences.english: This church receives no federal money and operates entirely on private donations.
sentences.chinese: 這座教堂沒有聯邦撥款，僅依靠私人捐贈經營。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to utilize/to put sth to use
